result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan B Ferra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Retain Possession (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan B Ferra

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant is NOT on Probation.  Restitution, costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 02-17-2017 or Civil Judgment WITH Tax Intercept.  sdg

Defendant Nathan B Ferra in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Nathan B Ferra in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve THIRTY (30) DAYS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to 15CM1037.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Restitution payable to PICK N' SAVE for TWO HUNDRED NINETY-NINE DOLLARS ($299.00) or civil judgment WITH tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges, supervision fees and restitution BY 02-17-2017 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH TAX INTERCEPT.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Defendant Nathan B Ferra in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Nathan B Ferra in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense moved to have Defendant's NEW case (15CM3888) transferred to Br. 33.  State does not object.  Court ACCEPTED the new matter into Br. 33.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Nathan B Ferra in court with attorney Barbara K Due for Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Attorney Rablin WAS contacted prior to the case being called on the Record.

Defendant failing to appear, On motion of the State, Court LIFTS THE STAY AND ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense requests Bench Warrant be STAYED.  State does NOT object.  COURT ISSUES AND STAYS BENCH WARRANT UNTIL THE NEXT DATE.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
JusticePoint Discharge Summary.  Filed, sdg.
State has not been able to notify the victim in this matter.  Case adjourned to 12-01-2015 at 3:00pm.  sdg
JusticePoint Pre-trial Report.  Dated 10-23-2015.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint Violation Report dated 10-16-2015.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Nathan B Ferra in Court with Attorney Dawn Rablin.  Brad Vorpahl appears for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Matter before the Court for Sentencing.  Due to the congestion of the Court's calendar and lateness of the hour, Court Orders case adjourned to Br. 33 for Sentencing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Nathan B Ferra in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State needs additional time to contact victim.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 33  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. cmt
Case transferred to Branch 33 for sentencing with 15CM1037 on 9-08-2015 at 3:00 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save - 6760 W National Ave
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Nathan B Ferra in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Nathan B Ferra in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
